mechanoreception.notes: As sponges, Trichogypsiidae likely possess basic mechanoreception to respond to water currents and physical stimuli. This is inferred based on general sponge biology.

chemoreception.notes: Sponges rely on chemoreception to detect food particles and other chemical cues in the water. This is inferred based on general sponge biology and feeding mechanisms.

photoreception.notes: The presence or absence of photoreceptors in Trichogypsiidae is currently unknown. Information is not available in the provided context.
